channel.title: Blogs on Home
channel.description: Recent content in Blogs on Home

item.title: Add devices to an Azure AD Group using the Microsoft Graph API
item.description: Have you ever needed to add a device to an Azure AD Group as part of your MEMCM or Autopilot deployment for specific app, profiles or scripts? Well it became the case that my organisation needed to do so for a couple of reason, one of those was to disable Windows Hello and the other for devices migrating from a previous Configuration Manager (Not MEMCM).

item.title: Enrol Devices to Autopilot (Unattended)
item.description: I have been working on a project at the company I work for, and up to this point we have been primarily focused on getting new devices imported and deploying via Autopilot. Now we have successfully leaped over that hurdle with very little issues (apart from the odd TPM attestation issue here and there and the ESP Profile page been skipped), we moved onto focusing on our current estate and how to import these into Autopilot .

item.title: Create an Azure App Registration
item.description: What can you use an Azure App Registration for An Azure App Registration has many uses, in my case I use it mainly for the Microsoft Graph API to perform Intune Configuration Profile backups, List devices, Update local CMDB dynamically and also enrol devices into Autopilot.

item.title: Breaking Down Custom OMA-URI (CSP) Policies
item.description: What is an OMA-URI Policy? Meaning: Open Mobile Alliance Uniform Resource Identifier Traditionally when you implement a new piece of software which contains Group Policy Objects (GPO’s) to customise the feature of the application you would import the .

item.title: Getting Useful Device Informationâ€¦ Troubleshooting Made Easy
item.description: SO… I’ve been working tirelessly in trying to get an Autopilot Hybrid Deployment working along with my colleagues. As any Tech does I give everything my blood sweat and tears before logging a call with support (Sound silly as we could waste hours… But where’s the fun in just logging a call), however on occasion you have to admit defeat and raise a service request.
